topic.title: Requesting features and reporting defects
topic.shortdesc: Defect reports and feature requests may be submitted at any time through the project page at github.

body.p: The core project contributors will track and address bugs reported against the project, and issue patches based on urgency. The core contributors will also provide feedback on requests for new features or design changes, but may not be able to provide development assistance on all requests.
All new bug reports or feature requests should be submitted through github: .

section.title: Requesting new features
section.p: Requests for new features may be submitted at any time. The project committers will have periodic reviews of new feature requests along with other contributors and interested parties and (when possible) make plans for implementation.

Generally, if an existing project developer is interested in a new request, the item will be assigned to that developer and implemented based on the developer's schedule. Otherwise, if the request is valid and in line with project goals, it will be left open for an interested party to pick up and implement. In some cases requests are best implemented as a customization (plug-in) outside of the core tools, in which case the request will be closed with suggested alternatives.

section.title: Defects
section.p: Defect reports may be submitted at any time using the same process. Project committers will determine the owner of the relevant components and assign the bug for validation and disposition. Responses, fixes, and workarounds are generally quickest if those submitting a defect report are able to include sample files or clear instructions for reproducing the issue.
If bugs are found in the OASIS DTDs or Schemas, they will be fixed in the toolkit and reported back to OASIS.
